meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my review of Men of War II!

So, I've just finished playing Men of War II, the latest real-time strategy game set in WWII. Now, I know what you're thinking... "RTS? That sounds so booooring." But trust me, this game is anything but! It's like a big ol' bowl of grog soup - it takes some getting used to, but once you dig in, you'll be hooked!

First off, let's talk about the gameplay. Men of War II is all about strategy and tactics. You've got your typical RTS stuff: building bases, gathering resources, and sending troops to battle. But then things get really interesting. The game has this super cool "real-time" combat system, where you can micromanage every last detail. Want to make sure that one squad of soldiers takes out the enemy's heavy artillery before they even think about attacking? Done! You can do all sorts of crazy stuff like that.

Now, I know some critics have been saying that the game is a bit overwhelming for new players. And yeah, it took me a little while to get used to everything. But once you're in the swing of things, it's actually kinda fun trying to figure out what the heck you're supposed to do! It's like solving a puzzle, and I love puzzles!

Of course, there are some downsides. Some folks have been complaining about the always-online requirement. And yeah, that can be a real pain if you don't have stable internet. But honestly, it's not the end of the world. And besides, once you get used to the game, you'll probably want to play it online with your friends anyway!

So what do I think? Well, let me just say... Hippo Penny approves! Men of War II is a solid RTS that will keep you busy for hours on end. Just don't forget to grab some snacks and comfy pants before diving in - this game can get intense!
